intro: Turbinicarpus pailanus, commonly known as the Pailan's Turbinicarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to Mexico, specifically the states of San Luis Potosí and Tamaulipas. This cactus is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white to grayish spines. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in the axils of the stems during the spring and summer months. It is a slow-growing, compact cactus that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
